cis.monopoly.gameDrawers

Class BoardDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis.monopoly.gameDrawers.BoardDrawer

  • public final class BoardDrawer
extends java.lang.Object

    BoardDrawer

    This class draws all the elements on the board including the board itslef and the players on the board.
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Kyle Turske

      • BOARD_LENGTH_BIG

        public static final int BOARD_LENGTH_BIG
        The length of the board if the screen is big. Also used for the height since that the board is square.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int BOARD_LENGTH_SMALL
        The length of the board if the screen is small. Also used for the height since that the board is square. is square.
        See Also:

      • PROPERTY_HEIGHT_BIG

        public static final int PROPERTY_HEIGHT_BIG
        The height of the properties if they are on the top or bottom row of the board if the screen size is big. Also used to define the width of the spaces that are on the left and right side of the board.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_HEIGHT_SMALL

        public static final int PROPERTY_HEIGHT_SMALL
        The height of the properties if they are on the top or bottom row of the board if the screen size is small. Also used to define the width of the spaces that are on the left and right side of the board.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_WIDTH_BIG

        public static final int PROPERTY_WIDTH_BIG
        The width of the properties if they are on the top or bottom row of the board. Also used to define the height of the spaces that are on the left and right side of the board. Bigger variation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_WIDTH_SMALL

        public static final int PROPERTY_WIDTH_SMALL
        The width of the properties if they are on the top or bottom row of the board. Also used to define the height of the spaces that are on the left and right side of the board. Smaller variation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_FLAG_HEIGHT_BIG

        public static final int PROPERTY_FLAG_HEIGHT_BIG
        Each property has a part of the their space that shows their corresponding color. This will be draw on the inner part of the space. So if the space is is on the side, then this value defines the height of flag. Bigger variation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_FLAH_HEIGHT_SMALL

        public static final int PROPERTY_FLAH_HEIGHT_SMALL
        Each property has a part of the their space that shows their corresponding color. This will be draw on the inner part of the space. So if the space is is on the side, then this value defines the height of flag. Smaller variation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PIECE_WIDTH_BIG

        public static final int PIECE_WIDTH_BIG
        This defines the height and width of each player piece, as each piece is a square. Bigger variation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PIECE_WIDTH_SMALL

        public static final int PIECE_WIDTH_SMALL
        This defines the height and width of each player piece, as each piece is a square. Smaller variation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GV_BLUE

        public static final javafx.scene.paint.Color GV_BLUE
        If you go to Grand Valley State University's web site, you can see that this hex value defines the color for "Grand Valley Blue." Used for the lettering, buttons, the dice drawer, and the center of the board as well.

      • drawPropertyTop

        public static void drawPropertyTop(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                                   int xpos,
                                   int ypos,
                                   javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Draws all of the properties on the top of the board.
        Parameters:
        gc - This parameter accepts the Graphics context of a canvas in which will draw the property on the top of the board.
        xpos - This defines the horizontal position of the property.
        ypos - This defines the vertical position of the property.
        color - This defines the color of the flag.

                                     int xpos,

      • drawCorner

        public static void drawCorner(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                              double xpos,
                              double ypos,
                              javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                              int cornerID)
        Used to draw all of the corners on the board.
        Parameters:
        gc - This parameter accepts the Graphics context of a canvas in which will draw the property on the top of the board.
        xpos - This defines the horizontal position of the property.
        ypos - This defines the vertical position of the property.
        color - This defines the color of the flag.
        cornerID - Defines which corner is being drawn

      • drawBoard

        public static void drawBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Takes all of the different "drawProperty" methods and loops through an array of all the different colors of the board (36) colors in total, and draws all of the properties starting at pos[1]. Pos[0] would be the bottom right corner. From positions 1-9, the method drawPropertyBottom is called. From positions 11-19, the method drawPropertyLeft is called. From positions 21-29 the method drawPropertTop is called. Finally after that, from the positions 31-39, the method drawProperty right is called. After all of the regular properties are drawn, next all of the corners are drawn in their respective position.
        Parameters:
        gc - This parameter accepts the Graphics context of a canvas in which will draw the property on the top of the board. The last thing this method does is draw all the pieces that are in play.
